definition: Wall Street, New York/by extension, American big business
Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua

sentences.english: And let there be no mistake: The blood is definitely running right now on Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 毋庸赘言，现在华尔街的确已经是血流成河了。

sentences.english: This white-knuckle improvisation was evident across Wall Street, too.
sentences.chinese: 这种充满刺激的即兴行为也明显影响到华尔街。

sentences.english: Organizers called on supporters to march from there to Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 组织者呼吁支持者从祖科蒂公园游行至华尔街。

sentences.english: The Wall Street Journal gives a daily report of the stock market.
sentences.chinese: 《华尔街日报》每天报告股市行情。

sentences.english: Wall Street economists had expected that the number would drop to 455, 000.
sentences.chinese: 华尔街经济学家原以为那个数字会将到45万5千的。

sentences.english: Yule sat behind a desk, reading The Wall Street Journal.
sentences.chinese: 于尔先生坐在办公桌后面看《华尔街日报》。

sentences.english: IT IS a fair bet that one of Barack Obama’s new-year’s resolutions was to rattle Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马新年改革之一很有可能会惹恼华尔街。

sentences.english: They were the line foremen at the giant Wall Street sausage factory.
sentences.chinese: 他们就像华尔街“香肠工厂”的领班。

sentences.english: There is a crisis unfolding on Wall Street, and Congress is not sure what to do about it.
sentences.chinese: 华尔街危机已经公布于众，国会还不确定要怎么去做。

sentences.english: Scabs are finally growing over Wall Street's gaping wounds.
sentences.chinese: 华尔街那些大大小小的伤口终于开始结痂愈合了。

sentences.english: The revolving door between Washington and Wall Street needs to be jammed.
sentences.chinese: 华盛顿与华尔街之间的旋转门亦需被堵住。

sentences.english: Initial reaction to the move on Wall Street and elsewhere has been cautiously positive.
sentences.chinese: 华尔街和其他地方对此举最初报以谨慎的肯定。

sentences.english: Pay scales on Wall Street continue to outstrip those in other professions outrageously.
sentences.chinese: 华尔街的工资水平依旧远远超过其他行业。

sentences.english: So is this just a Wall Street trope?
sentences.chinese: Careny问到，”这仅仅是华尔街的一面之词？

sentences.english: But the history of Wall Street is a series of booms and busts.
sentences.chinese: 但是华尔街的历史，就是一系列的繁荣和崩溃。

sentences.english: He could not rank as yet with the magnates of the eastthe serried sequoias of wall street .
sentences.chinese: 他还不能够同东部大王们华尔街林立的参天红杉并列。

definition: Bloomberg (name)/Michael Bloomberg (1942-), US billionaire businessman, politician and philanthropist
Paulson or Powellson (name)/Henry (Hank) Paulson (1946-), US banker, US Treasury Secretary from 2006
Warren Buffett (1930-), the Sage of Omaha, US investor and philanthropist, principal owner of holding company Berkshire Hathaway
